Description: Ionian terracotta figure vase (plastic vase). Probably fragment of alabastron in form of a bust of a woman. Pressed into two piece mould, then the surface was polished or burnished. Fine pale cream Ionian clay fabric with sparse fine black inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5(?)
Curator's comments: Marked Φ in pencil, and '1160,2'. Closest parallel for this small fragment are two mid 6th century BC examples, one from a Kamiros tomb, BM 1861,1024.7, and BM 1852,0112.6, possibly purchased in Etruria. Both were originally thought to be of Rhodian origin, like this example (Higgins 1954: 44-5; 1959: 23). Same fabric as BM1888,0601.752 and BM1888,0601.752a. Probably same vessel as BM1888,0601.752.b. In Jones' Optical Emission Spectroscopy analysis of BM1888,0601.752.b the piece was assigned to his Ionian B group: Jones 1986, 668-70. Jones, R.E., Greek and Cypriot pottery: a review of scientific studies, Athens, 1986; p.668-70
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (1630)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.024) (Phase 3)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committee of)
